 2009-02462009-02-12FIN,  ,  ,  , 
ActBank Act
PrecisREGULATIONS AMENDING THE ACCESS TO BASIC BANKING SERVICES REGULATIONS amendments were made in Bill C-37 to: - harmonize online and in-branch disclosure requirements to ensure that consumers have sufficient information regardless of how they interact with their financial institution, - require that all member banks make the prescribed information available on their websites through which products and services are offered in Canada, - add territorial health insurance cards and the Citizenship and Immigration Canada Form IMM5292, which is the confirmation of permanent residence form, as permitted identification, and - limit the use of the OAS card as permitted identification to cases where the card bears the SIN and name of an individual. The Regulations also amend the definition of point of service.
RegistrationRegistration: SOR/ 2009-0049 Publication Date: 2009-03-04
AttachmentsAttachment
precis:
REGULATIONS AMENDING THE ACCESS TO BASIC BANKING SERVICES REGULATIONS amendments were made in Bill C-37 to:
  - harmonize online and in-branch disclosure requirements to ensure that consumers have sufficient information regardless of how they interact with their financial institution,
  - require that all member banks make the prescribed information available on their websites through which products and services are offered in Canada,
  - add territorial health insurance cards and the Citizenship and Immigration Canada Form IMM5292, which is the confirmation of permanent residence form, as permitted identification, and
  - limit the use of the OAS card as permitted identification to cases where the card bears the SIN and name of an individual.  The Regulations also amend the definition of point of service.
